item.title: Beth add a quote by Eudora Welty
item.description: "People give pain, are callous and insensitive, empty and cruel...but place heals the hurt, soothes the outrage, fills the terrible vacuum that these human beings make." -- Eudora Welty

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I am impelled, not to squeak like a grateful and apologetic mouse, but to roar like a lion out of pride in my profession." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "If you're in trouble, or hurt or need - go to the poor people. They're the only ones that'll help - the only ones." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "Men do change, and change comes like a little wind that ruffles the curtains at dawn, and it comes like the stealthy perfume of wildflowers hidden in the grass." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Beth add a quote by Zora Neale Hurston
item.description: "If you want that good feeling that comes from doing things for other folks then you have to pay for it in abuse and misunderstanding." -- Zora Neale Hurston

item.title: Beth add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "I swear to the Lord,I still can't see,Why Democracy means,Everybody but me. " -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Beth add a quote by Michael Upchurch
item.description: "The ultimate luxury is to reread: to revisit a book to see how time has treated it, how memory has distorted it, or how my own passing years have cast a new light on it." -- Michael Upchurch

item.title: Beth add a quote by Archbishop Oscar Romero
item.description:
"Peace is not the product of terror or fear. Peace is not the silence of cemeteries. Peace is not the silent result of violent repression. Peace is the generous, tranquil contribution of all to the good of all. Peace is dynamism. Peace is generosity. It is right and it is duty.
" -- Archbishop Oscar Romero
